intro: Mesembryanthemum purpureocroceum, commonly known as the purple crocus mesem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces vibrant yellow to orange flowers with a distinctive purple center, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it an attractive addition to xeriscaped landscapes.
